body: hmm. not sure about that. 99% of all computer should be powerful enough for that. and for the others we introduced this config switch you mentioned.

> more advanced users can enable many more using the admin page in a progressive-disclosure method.

more advanced users can disable thumbnail generation in the configuration.

@karlitschek agree about the computer power. in fact raspberry pi is probably part of the 1% computer power you mentioned, along with arduino's and alikes (not counting 3rd world countries of course). i don't know however how much % of owncloud users are running owncloud on these for a personal cloud (instead of running a full server at their homes). the raspberry pi forum however contains a lot of those ;-)

@deepdiver1975 not sure it goes in the direction of progressive disclosure for usability (in my opinion the core feature is to have a fast sync process, thumbnails previews slow them): http://www.nngroup.com/articles/progressive-disclosure/

"initially, show users only a few of the most important options.
offer a larger set of specialized options upon request. disclose these secondary features only if a user asks for them, meaning that most users can proceed with their tasks without worrying about this added complexity.
[...]
you might assume that by initially focusing users' attention on a few core features, they might build a limiting mental model of the system and thus be unable to understand all of their options. research says that these are groundless worries: people understand a system better when you help them prioritize features and spend more time on the most important ones."

but again, is all a matter of product strategy, about who are the main targets of owncloud ;-) that's surely up to you (as well as deciding if thumbs preview resources reqs are worth for a primary or secondary feature-level, within the whole owncloud featureset, bookmarks, contacts, calendar,...) mine was only a user suggestion. thanks for your time reading this anyway. glad to use oc everyday thanks to you.
